description:
Pangaex is a world-conquering game with aspects of Risk, Catan, and Terraforming Mars. The game is played on a modular board (81 2"-square tiles), each of which indicates one of the following resources: Culture, Food, Weapons, Commerce, Mountains, or Lakes. Each player starts with a Capital game piece and two village game pieces, which are placed in a snake-draft system. Each player also begins with some resources and a soldier, who begins the game on the Capital tile.

The game is played in two repeating phases: Production phase (collecting resources based on villages and/or soldiers in play), and Action phase. The Production phase happens simultaneously, where all players collect resources at the same time. The Action phase is where the bulk of the game is played. Players can move their soldiers; they can also use resources to build villages, train soldiers, and even convert enemy villages to their own culture. Like Terraforming Mars, each player may take up to two actions on their turn--however, a pass is not a pass for the whole Action phase, but merely a pass on a given turn. The Action phase ends when all players have passed consecutively.

Soldiers are more than just soldiers in Pangaex. Soldiers raze enemy villages, but they also help to rebuild their own villages. They prevent peaceful cultural conversion, and they even collect resources at times.

When any player plays their final village, the game ends after the Action phase concludes (i.e. final village signifies final round, not final play). Points are awarded for villages on the board, enemy villages that you've collected (by razing or converting), and other metrics to balance out the game.

—description from the designer

Échec aux Chevaliers is the tranposition into a board game of the fights that took place in the Middle Ages between the Knights and the men-at-arms.

We play with two players, even if it is possible to play with four. The object of the game is to successfully capture the opponent's citadel and stay there for an entire turn without being captured.

Échec aux Chevaliers is a fairly rare game. It is indeed sought after by both board game enthusiasts and collectors of Mokarex figurines.

Sigil is a two player, abstract board game, along the lines of Mancala.

In it, both players move the same pieces around the board in an attempt to leave their opponent unable to take a turn.

—description from the designer

By our calendar, the third day of the month of storms was when our world changed forever. Each of the leaders of the five great nations were assassinated by an unknown force, leaving the councils and elders fumbling to reply to this unknown threat. Many laid blame at the feet of ancestral hatreds. The Dwarves blamed the Goblins. The Orcs blamed the Elves. The Humans blamed the Orcs. and the Goblins blamed everyone, as befits their fear and paranoia. What the secretive Elves believe is a thing of mystery...though perhaps you will be the one to uncover the truth?

The Edgeguard is to be a force of elite warriors, rangers, clerics, mages, and rogues—the best of the best. Each nation will contribute forces with a mandate to seek out our mysterious new enemy and report back to their leaders. From these humble beginnings, five heroes will arise, one from each nation, to become our championsâ —the defenders of Ebonmoor.

Edgeguard is a story-driven tabletop miniatures game for 1-4 players drawing mechanical inspiration from classic experiences across both table and screen—featuring highly detailed miniatures, immersive mechanics, and beautiful artwork.

—description from the designer

Robbits (the nickname for Urban Halflings) are a small mischievous folk with an uncanny habit of ‘finding’ ancient relics of vast and horrifying power. In this case, a troublesome Ring, belonging to an evil wizard called Nörmün. Nörmün has sent his Goblins to retrieve the Ring, even as the Wizard Gudgrief tries to form a Party of Dwarves, Elves and Robbits to take the Ring away on a Quest.

But the reluctant Robbits know that nobody ever comes back from Gudgrief’s Quests, so the Dwarves are forced to Press-Gang and the Elves to Enchant them out of their Pits to join the Party. However, Robbits are innately ‘Tricksy’ and will use Magic and Excuses to avoid going on the Quest. Only one Robbit will live to tell the epic tale of...
The Thing with the Ring!

In The Thing with the Ring, you take on the role of a Robbit and the object of the game is to avoid going on the Quest to get rid of the evil Ring. Dwarves, Elves and Goblins will turn up on your doorstep and you must manage them with Magic and Excuses or risk joining the Party and going on the Quest.

The Game is for one to six Players and it is comprised of one Rulebook, one hundred cards, and one die, known as the Battle Die.

—description from the publisher

Go Make a Hike is a competitive tile drafting and placement game for 2-4 players (with a solo mode) about building the perfect hiking path. Each round, players will draft either a Trail or Destination tile to add to their Trail System. Destinations require certain features along their trail: Water, Flowers, Wildlife, or Viewpoints.

As players work to build the perfect hike their trails will grow and spread across the table in an impressive display of nature's beauty!

Solo mode included.

In Polyhedral Predicaments - Dungeon Demise you are a hero delving deep into a dungeon in search of treasures. You'll encounter a maze of rooms, each with a powerful enemy, weapons and tools that will help you on your journey, as well as coins and gems. Collect what you can, survive if you are able, and defeat the dungeon boss at the end to earn a trove of valuables!

Polyhedral Predicaments is a series within a series! These are small, 18-card games that share similar mechanics as you go on adventures and survive disasters.

Hanki-Panki is going on. Sex is a natural part of life. But the question is Who? is doing What? to Whom? and Where?

This game is your chance to be an investigative reporter and uncover the naked truth. If you are the first plater to correctly catch a couple in the act - YOU WIN!!!

On your turn, roll the dice to determine how many spaces you can move. When you reach a room, ask another player to reveal one fact they know. Keep your notes and try to narrow down who did what, to whom, and where.

A card game for children and others, 5 years and up. You're trying to build a play house by drawing cards from the other players, but avoiding the "Ouch, my finger!" cards.

On your turn, you choose to either

a) draw a building card from another player's hand into your own hand. If you draw an "Ouch, my finger!" card, you discard that and your entire hand of building cards to the bottom of the draw pile.

b) play a subgame where you place one of your tool cards face down and say "Tool". All other players will now also place one of their tool cards face down, and then everybody reveals their chosen tool. The active player will draw a building card from the draw pile, if at least one other player has chosen a different tool. Each of the other players will draw a card, if they chose the same tool as the active player.

At the end of your turn you win by having all four different building cards in your hand. Otherwise play passes to the next player.

Farm Club is an optimisation game with simple rules but requiring crucial decisions to be made.

On his turn, each player chooses from the available lots (animal + objective) the one combination that best serves their strategy: should they take a sheep or a duck? Where should they place it on his farm?

With only 9 rounds of play, Farm Club is fast-paced and constantly requires players to use their judgement : each animal, objective or placement will have an impact on the final score and so they should make good use of the 2 special actions allowing them to reorganise their farm or renew the supply of animals and objectives.

After 9 rounds, the player with the highest score wins.

ã‚‚ã‚„ã£ã¨æµ·å›³ (Moyatto Kaizu) is an exploration game from Japan. The game title means something like 'hazy sea charts'. Players are building up a nautical chart from memory of their voyages, complete with sea monsters. But they aren't quite sure what goes where, and work together to remember what they saw.

In the game, players place tiles showing land and sea. As they place a tile, they can add player pieces, or a pawn worth 2 pieces. If a tile gets to four pieces, it is confident enough to stay. But if it has fewer than four, then some black balls are added to make it up to four.

When a continent is completed, it is scored. Players with the most pieces/pawns get the most points (counting all the pieces on the island), for having been most confident in their memory of the voyage. The next most gets the points of the majority pieces, and so on down. There are bonus points for places of interest on the land (buried treasure) and for adjacent sea monsters.

But the black balls are collected by the majority scorer, and count as negative at the end of the game, along with any player pieces remaining in hand.

The game ends when ten black balls have been used.

The game is a mix of co-operating, and bluffing to complete island with the most confidence.
user summary

In Star Wars Villainous: Power of the Dark Side, each player takes control of one of five Star Wars characters: Darth Vader, Asajj Ventress, Kylo Ren, Moff Gideon, or General Grievous. Each player has their own villain deck, fate deck, player board, and 3D character.

On a turn, the active player moves their character to a different location on their player board, takes one or more of the actions visible on that space (often by playing cards from their hand), then refills their hand to four cards. Cards are allies, items, effects, and other things. You need to use your cards to fulfill your unique win condition.

One of the actions allows you to choose another player, draw two cards from that player's fate deck, then play one of them on that player's board, covering two of the four action spaces on one of that player's locations. The fate deck contains heroes, items, and effects from that villain's storyline, and these cards allow other players to mess with that particular villain.

Depending on their villain's unique power, players can also use their villain's "ambition" to perform actions that power effects based on the villain's use of the Force, strategic leadership, or sheer luck. The game also incorporates villain-specific missions and rules for iconic ships and transports from all corners of the Star Wars galaxy.

Oh no, the mine is collapsing!
Hurry, get in the wagon and head towards the exit!

Infernal Wagon is an intensely fun cooperative game in which players must work together to create a path to the exit… before time runs out! But be careful: each card played has a high chance of triggering devastating effects!

A game of Infernal Wagon plays in 7 minutes at most, until one of the end game conditions is met. In this cooperative game, all players win or lose together.

At the start of the game, place the 3 starting cards and the wagon on the last one. There is no turn order: when the time is right, the player with the best card plays and activates its effect. They draw a card and any other player can take a turn (in the  2 players variant, you can play 2 cards consecutively). Once a card is played, move the wagon onto it. Place the exit card in the 7 minutes time span to win the game!

—description from the publisher

The forensic scientists of the Glitch Squad have each been assigned a crime scene to analyze. Unfortunately, the office cat — Glitch — has accidentally changed the password to all of the evidence lockers.

Each round, you write 3 clues to help one of your teammates guess a piece of evidence related to the crime:  location, weapon, occupation, or hobby. Unfortunately, Glitch the cat messes up these clues. Acting as the meddlesome cat, your opponent gets to erase one of the clues, and write in a "Glitched" clue to stump your ally.

Can you guess the evidence from the clues, knowing one of them is glitched? If so, you reveal the next letter in the password to your evidence locker! If not, the opponent who glitched your clues gets the next letter in their password. The first team to guess all of their passwords wins!

Planting Evidence is a card game for 2-4 players that pits you against your criminal friends.

Each round, players must choose between planting incriminating evidence on their fellow criminals or using similar evidence to build up their alibis.

Build sets of cards to assemble fingerprints from partials, reconstruct DNA, build a car license plate profile, or submit weapons for review.

Be careful not to trigger the end of the game unless you have the least evidence against you, or you lose!

—description from the publisher

Competition is fierce, money is tight, and your critical task as team manager is to build a dream lineup of basketball superstars.

Basketboss is an auction game where each season you’ll be responsible for managing all the complexities of a professional basketball team.

Your principal task is to offer the best contracts to players at auction. You’ll also have to make sure you can hire the right team advisors - as they provide special powers that can dramatically improve your lineup if used properly. For example, the Physical Therapist can help you avoid crippling injuries!

Will your lineup be stacked with Hall of Famers and your shelves full of gleaming trophies?

—description from the publisher

They say they have seen the beautiful kitsune in the forest: Let's go find them to win their friendship!

Only those with luck on their side will be able to find them. If you risk enough, you might get to see the little foxes, but if you approach them carelessly... you can scare them away and you'll lose them! In addition, the mischievous Oni are always hanging around, to change everything with their pranks.

The objective of the game is to collect 3 kitsune of each color (Red, Blue and Yellow), if 2 to 4 players play. For 5 and 6 players you must collect 2 kitsune of each color. If at the end of your turn you have the required number of foxes, you win immediately.

To do this you must reveal cards trying not to repeat any color. At any time you can stop and resolve the cards in any order you choose:

    Kitsune help you win.
    Renewal cards allow you to draw cards from other players
    Prosperity cards help you protect your little foxes
    Oni cards are played instantly to help or harm others.

Somewhere in the not too distant future, Chris Ramsay sent a distress beacon from the Hadrian Base Station. This is where YOU come in! Can you help Chris track down and eliminate the A.C.E clones?
 This is a stand-alone escape game that comes complete with the following:

     Mobile/Desktop Digital Experience
     Vektek Security Booklet
     Game Cards
     1 Deck of USPCC playing cards


This is an escape room game produced by youtuber, magician, and puzzler Chris Ramsay.

ã‚»ãƒ–ãƒ³ã‚¯ã‚©ãƒ¼ãƒ„ (Seven QuartZ) is a two player card game from Japan. Players are duelling but with only three cards. The goal is to get gem cards, but not to go bust.

Players take on the role of two magicians fighting to get the gems. In the deck, there are seven magicians to choose from, and 28 skills (from 14 cards). Each player gets a magician card and two skill cards, using this combo to try to win gems valued 0-3 (from 30 gem cards). But if they make a total over 7, they go bust.

The designer styles it as a fast game like blackjack with a lot of replay from 100s of possible combos to try.
user summary

Soul of Ankiril is a Strategic Card Game where players will compete using thematic decks of 25 cards, one of each element or Temen (Fire, Air, Water, Earth, Wood and Metal), with the aim of deactivating the Emanation Portals on the opponent’s field. To do this, players will move their creatures on a board made up of hexagons, then it will be up to them to make the most of the map to achieve victory.

Each player will be able to construct their deck and choose a specific Board that represents their half of the battlefield, once the two players connects their halves the game can start! Both players will then place their Emanation portals and Leaders.

During their turn, players will be be able to:

- Play a card from their hand (Creature or Spell) for 1 Energy Point.
- Move a creature on the board.
- Attack or Activate a Special Ability.
- Draw a Card for 1 Energy Point.

Most of the Creatures will attack and move by the adjacent hexagon but this range can be increased thanks to spells and Special Ability like Throw or Overfly.

First Player that deactivates the 3 Emanation Portals of the opponent wins the game!

Each Creature is unique so during the Deck Construction phase before a match it will be crucial to choose the best combination of Creatures and Spells even of different Temen.

—description from the publisher

Mushroom season is finally here, Granny has asked you to fill the pantry and promises to cook a delicious mushroom pie once you get back. The forest is dangerous and it’s easy to get lost, but you can’t disappoint Granny!

Bolets is a 9 card game that you can play in about 10 minutes. It’s fairly easy to learn and the setup is quickly.

In this abstract card game, you have to overlap the eight map cards and trace a path to travel from card to card, until you reach Granny’s Cottage, with at least one life left. On the way, be careful with the crows and collect as many mushroom points as you can, to beat your own score.

—description from the designer

The Bells Toll for Madrid is a two player free PnP game simulating the advance of Franco´s rebel forces aiming to capture Madrid in the early stages of the Spanish Civil War 1936/39.

The game includes a rules set, 192 two sided counters and an A2 (17”x 22”) map; all components will be made available in the files section of this page. Only a six sided die needs to be provided.

People from all over the realm come to the Dungeon with the hopes of winning gold, magic and glory. They are not heroes. They are not trained. They do not have supernatural powers. And only one of them is going to survive.

Viva La Dungeon! is a battle-royal dungeon-crawling game of hidden movement, treasure-looting and player versus player combat for up to 4 players.

Players move around the Dungeon, finding equipment, and finding each other to pick-pocket or fight while the Gelatinous Cubes slowly make the map smaller and smaller.

Based off the live Twitch game show, Viva La Dungeon brings the chaotic fun of the livestream to your family's game table.

—description from the publisher

Guide the first humans on their journey as they migrate throughout the world while developing their technology and culture.

CATAN: Dawn of Humankind is a reboot of The Settlers of the Stone Age, with gameplay rooted in the original CATAN, while featuring new elements, strategies, and adventures to discover.

—description from the publisher

Pletore is a drawless territory game for two players: Black and White. It is played on the intersections (points) of an initially empty square grid (board).

Pletore was inspired by MichaÅ‚ ZapaÅ‚a's Tumbleweed.

				
				
					DefinitionsTwo stones, or a stone and an empty point, see each other if they lie on the same row or column and there are no other stones between them along that line.

You pinch a point if it sees stones of your color in at least one horizontal direction and one vertical direction.

You control a point if you pinch it while your opponent does not.

				
				
					PlayBlack plays first, then turns alternate. On your turn, perform exactly one of the following actions:


     Pass, provided that there are no empty points or every empty point is controlled by some player.
     Place a stone of your color on an empty point not controlled by your opponent.
     Remove an enemy stone from a point you control and place a stone of your color on that point.


On even-sized boards only, to prevent mirror play, the position after White's first move must be such that swapping the two stones on the board is not equivalent to rotating the board by 180º.

The game ends when both players pass in succession. The player with the higher score in the final position wins. Your score is the number of stones of your color on the board, plus the number of empty points you control, plus komi in the case of White. The button is used to avoid ties.

				
				
					Komi and buttonKomi is the whole number of points which is added to White's score at the end of the game as compensation for going second. Before the game starts, the first player chooses the value of komi, and then the second player chooses sides. Alternatively, experienced players may agree on a standard value for all games.

The button is a special token which is placed next to the board at the start of the game. It is only used when komi and the board size have the same parity (i.e. they are both odd or both even). On your turn, if neither player has taken the button yet, you may not pass, but you may take the button instead of making a board play. At the end of the game, a half point is added to the score of the player who has taken the button.

The dealer deals three cards to each player and gives each one a bottom bun. The dealer then replaces the remaining cards in a pile with the number face down.

The first player to build a burger consisting of 10 topping cards, numbered lowest to highest, wins!

—description from the inside of the box

Play as a biathlete in an unbearable suspense race. Biathlon Crystal Globe offers you the possibility of competing in all biathlon disciplines (Sprint, Pursuit, Mass Start, Relay, etc.). One day race, season or Championship. 
Become master of the Crystal Globe!

Choose his characteristics, rather very good at shooting or very good at skiing, unless you prefer him to be good in both disciplines. Each type of biathlete has its own movement die. Build your race to surprise your opponents. You have energy cards that allow you to make the difference in the terrible climbs to leave your competitors behind. But this reserve is not inexhaustible. It's a safe bet that the fate of your race will be decided on the shooting range.

Shooting lying down or standing up, with or without wind, you will have to choose for your biathlete between a fast but risky shot or a more steady and safer shot. Two very different strategies but both can be winning. Because each missed ball will make you lose a lot of time on the penalty ring. It's up to you to choose the one that will win the day before you make the last lap, with the other biathletes chasing you.

Goal of the game: Embody a biathlete during an unbearable suspense race.
How to play: Choose their characteristics, rather very good at shooting or very good at skiing, unless you prefer them to be good in both disciplines. Each type of biathlete has its own set of movement die, shooting dice and Energy deck. 
You have energy cards that allow you to make the difference in the terrible climbs to leave your competitors behind. But this reserve is not inexhaustible. It's a safe bet that the fate of your race will be decided on the shooting range.

Shooting lying down or standing up, with or without wind, you will have to choose for your biathlete between a fast but risky shot or a more steady and safer shot. Two very different strategies but both can be winning. Because each missed ball will make you lose a lot of time on the penalty ring. It's up to you to choose the one that will win the day before you make the last lap, with the other biathletes chasing you.
End of the game: Cross the finish line.

— Description from the publisher

é­”çŽ‹å¤§æˆ¦ãƒ–ãƒƒãƒˆãƒã‚¯ãƒ©ãƒƒã‚·ãƒ¥ (Satans War Buttoba Crash) is an action game from Japan. Players flick their monsters onto Satan's castle, trying to earn enough reward to gather three 'heroes'. The first player to recruit three heroes, such as Dracula, Succubus, Vorpal Bunny, or Hanako in the toilet, is the winner.

One player acts as Satan and defends a large castle, made from staggered boxes as a dias, with a throne at the top. The other players have a Demon King, one of eight such as Lucifer, Cthulhu, or Nurarihyon. Each Demon King starts with special abilities to help the player.

The game uses highly decorated plastic cards. The player takes their plastic Demon King card and inserts it vertical into a base card. This creates a flicking device. By holding the base down, and bending the card back, a player can flick their small foam creatures up onto the castle levels. Satan can defend the castle platform with its own cards, or use whatever toys or plushies a player has to hand.

As the game progresses, the attackers try to steal money from the castle, and use this to recruit 'heroes' to their side. These heroes bring more powers and abilities to the cause, and strengthen the attack in different ways. For example, the Vorpal Bunny increases the attack magnification to the throne by 100 times and exerts super high firepower, but Hanako in the toilet nullifies the attack on the throne. Getting Hanako-san from the toilet keeps the player with Vorpal Bunny in check. Players can choose to work together, and a player might even be better off attacking themselves. The game system is very open and fluid in the way the characters' abilities work.

The first player to gain three heroes to their side is the winner.
user summary

GolfPro Card Game gives players the 18-hole experience while allowing families and friends to spend time together, chatting, laughing, and having fun playing golf around the table.

Wisely choose the best club cards to get on the green, avoid actions that will land you penalties, and then putt out in the least strokes possible! Scores just like golf.

Like the real course, GolfPro is a game of strategy and luck. But now you can play anywhere, anytime. When was the last time you played golf at home?

You can choose from Drivers, Woods, Long Irons, Short Irons, Wedges, or Chips. Your goal is to get on the green in the fewest strokes, then once you’re on the green, draw a putter card and lay it face down on your cards… Don’t look until everyone is on the green!

Like on the course, you’re not always going to have a great shot. There are several hazards that can appear on the club card faces:

Out of Bounds, In the Trees, In the Water, Topped it, Chunked It, and In the Bunker… if you pull one you must follow what it says!

Included are Hole-in One cards, Holed It Wedges, and several Chip-In cards.

Four players compete to keep/gain cities of the Ottoman Empire in Europe. The player with most cities under his control after 7 rounds is the winner. The game introduces a 4-outcome mechanism to conclude the result of each attack on a city using a fortune wheel. No dices used at all. Other game mechanisms include cards, pick of advantages from a table, etc.

—description from the designer

A card game of "Water Margin", one of the Four Great Classical Novels of Chinese literature.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Water_Margin
Out of the story of the novel, this game expresses a big battle and a hot bond by 108 heroes.
108 cards
1 turn marker
3 round markers
2 dice
2 pages of rules
1 player's guide

A multi-player game that expresses the activities of famous military commanders in the novel "Romance of the Three Kingdoms" in a battle with cards. With the fun of handling people as the most important factor, this game reproduces the uniqueness of "Romance of the Three Kingdoms" such as "single combat" and "strategy" with a simple and exciting battle system.
208 cards
6 management sheets
approximately 100 counters
1 map
2 pages of rules

This game reproduces the first work of the TV game "Resident Evil" with cards. Rather than having each player compete for victory or defeat, everyone works together to achieve their goals. If not achieved within the time limit, everyone will be defeated.
80 search cards
16 event cards
4 caracter sheets
1 distance display
72 counters
1 map
2 pages of rules

This is a campaign wargame of the novel "Romance of the Three Kingdoms" and deals from the death of Dong Zhuo to the White Emperor Castle. This game is limited to 3 players (Liu Bei, Cao Cao, and Sun Quan), and the campaign can be played in one day.
315 units
1 map
20 fate cards
4 politics cards
3 charts
3 corps sheets
1 explanation sheet
7 pages of rules

Sekigahara Warriors is a simulation game that reproduces the "Battle of Sekigahara", the biggest battle in Japan's Sengoku period.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Sekigahara
The map was cut from the foot of Mt. Momokubari in the east to Fuwa no Seki in the west, from Mt. Sasao in the north to Mt. Matsuo in the south. The victory condition includes the element of "betrayal" that is indispensable for the battle of Sekigahara, and players can enjoy purely clashes between units.
In order to create the atmosphere of the battle at that time, the battle logic is extremely deformed for a simulation game of this scale. In other words, the front side of the piece expresses the ability as a unit, but when it is damaged and becomes the back side, it expresses the ability of the individual military commander. In terms of wargames, the front side is the operational level and the back side is the tactical level. If the soldiers are lost due to damage, the military commander will fight directly.
There is also a twist on the victory conditions. The point is that "when the military commander retreats, Kobayakawa's heart shakes."

Winds of Caribbean is a naval battle-themed game of sailing ships during the Age of Discovery, based on the system of the masterpiece Wings of War: Dawn of War. Players control sailboats, shoot cannons, and sometimes come alongside to fight and aim for victory.
The big difference between Wings of War and Winds of Caribbean is that the former has the same direction of movement and attack, while the later has different directions of movement and attack. The theory of naval battles during the age of sail was to face the enemy on the side where the cannons were lined up, and this game also reproduced that. You can experience a different battle from the air battle, such as how to switch between movement and attack. In addition, the cannon reflects the performance of the time, it requires loading of bullets for each attack and the rapid fire does not work, and if the ship moves violently, the hit rate will drop or it will not be possible to load. It also includes the element that if a fire breaks out due to being hit, the fire must be extinguished. When ships collide with each other, side-to-side battle (aboldage) also occurs. Some ships are better at this, so pirate style is also possible.
The feature of the component is that the display such as loading of bullets and decrease of hit rate is set to "character + lines". It is also an expression that the commander's ability and command occupy a large weight in the naval battle at that time.
There are three types of ships: caravel, carrack, and small galleon.

Cat Collection Card Game is a table game that can be played from the lower grades of elementary school. You can play from 2 to 4 people at once.

The game includes cards that represent cats and items. Players use item cards to compete for how to bring cats to their place.
There are cats such as stray cat, boss cat, tortoiseshell cat, celebrity cat, etc. and some of them have different favorite items as well as abilities. Each cat has a score, and the player who collects a certain number of points wins the game. There is a difference in the score between a cat that can be caught by one mouse and a celebrity cat with a pedigree, and there are also compatibility between cats, so it is important to think about how to collect them.

Items are replenished from the deck, but some are easy to get and some are not, and some items have special effects, so planning is important. However, happenings such as stray cats and crows may appear, so it does not go exactly as planned. The rules are simple in a game like picture matching, but there are also elements of 
replay.

Play time is about 15 minutes. Planning is important when playing with two people, and reading the flow of the place and a little luck is important when playing with four people.

This game has no relations with a mobile cat collecting game "Neko Atsume".

Senryaku-Daimyo is a board game for 3 to 4 players who aims to prosper in their own country by taking the position of a daimyo during the Sengoku period.

When you think of a game during the Sengoku period, you might think of a battle for territory without humanity and justice, but this "Senryaku-Daimyo" includes not only "battle" but also territorial management elements such as commerce and industrial development. You can enjoy the trade-in that suits your style.

The starting line at the start of the game is the same for all players. The number of territories, economic power, and human assets are the same. From there, players will continue to prosper their country while acquiring cards for their policies and territories. You may focus on industrial development such as "hydraulic control" and "land survey", or you may focus on commercial promotion such as "free trade" and "money casting". Of course, you may expand your territory and make your country bigger by the battle unique to the Sengoku period. Ultimately, who enriched the country the most is determined by the total number of victory points on those cards, so it's completely up to you what direction you're aiming for.

Of course, among the routes mentioned above, the expansion of the territory has a great deal of economic gain, which greatly contributes to victory. However, the act of relying on force is not unrelated to the interference of other countries. In addition, events such as storms and floods and riots occur suddenly, so territorial management does not go as planned. Sometimes it will be necessary to make bold use of human resources during the Sengoku period.

Is it possible to outsmart the speculation of other countries and build the richest country in Japan?

Okehazama-Senki is a historical war simulation game that reproduces the battle between Oda Nobunaga and Imagawa Yoshimoto on May 19, 1560.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Okehazama
The number of players is 2, the number of pieces is 48, and the play time is 60 to 90 minutes. The player will be in the position of Oda Nobunaga or Imagawa Yoshimoto, aiming for victory.

In Okehazama-Senki, you can try different unit arrangements from the historical facts, and it is designed so that both Oda side and Imagawa side can try various strategies.

ãƒ€ãƒ³ã‚¸ãƒ§ãƒ³ï¼†ãƒ€ãƒ³ã‚²ãƒ­ã‚¹ (Dungeon & Dangerous) is a dungeon crawl game from Japan, aimed at older players. Players are the students of a school that discover a monster-filled dungeon in the basement of their school. Aided by faculty and staff, students and friends, they explore the dungeon and defeat the various demons and creatures below. Their goal is to find a secret legendary book somewhere in the dungeon.

The game is designed to be played multiple times, with one to four players if playing co-op. Players choose from eight different characters With modular components, abundant friends to choose from, and a variety of scenarios, the game also includes online elements to maintain the uncertainty and suspense.

Subsequent to its publication, the designer has created more characters and scenarios to be found online.

A DX edition was published originally which gave more characters, six more scenarios and a guidebook and reference material to enable players to build their own characters and scenarios.
user summary

In ã‚®ãƒ«ãƒ‰ãƒ“ãƒ«ãƒ‰ (Guild Build), players work to build an adventuring party in a fantasy world of anthropomorphic bird people. Characters include familiar roles such as Mage, Warrior, Cleric, and Crafter. Having the right party members allows you to score victory points through quests, events, and special achievements.

On a player's turn, they select one of five quest cards: Conquer, Defend, Gather, Explore, and Recruit. Conquer, Defend, and Gather allow you to score points on different score tracks, which allow you to earn Feat Cards. Explore let you draw an Event Card, which causes players to gain or lose resources based on their party members. Recruit allows you to hire party members with coins from the current market.

Players can earn victory points from advancing on the score tracks to earn Feat Cards, from all of their party members, and from Legendary Cards earned from collecting certain party members or fifteen coins.

The game ends when a player gains a certain number of party members, which varies based on the number of players. The player with the most victory points at that time is the winner.

Hope Lost is a 2-4 player cooperative choose-your-own-apocalypse game, featuring 6 different apocalypses to play through, each with their own objective and unique spin to the game’s common mechanics. Players will need to fight the apocalypses as well as time itself, all the while trying to make sure the survivors at the base have everything they need. Will you survive the apocalypse, or is all hope lost?

—description from the designer

Goal: to SNAP! Up as many cards as you can and be the last player with cards left after all the other players have run out of cards.
Instructions: Shuffle the deck of 36 cards and deal an equal amount to each player which they place in front of them in a face down pile.
Each player takes turns placing a card from the top of their pile face up in the centre of the table. Whenever two matching cards are placed on top of each other the first player to shout “wiggles SNAP!” collects the centre cards and puts them face down below their pile. 
When a player runs out of cards they are out of the game. The last player remaining is the winner.

Zapad 2020 is a small game released in the World War 3 system, published in the 43 issue of the Taktyka i Strategia magazine.

Game covers hypothetical operation of the Russian army at Ukraine 2020, where Russians are trying to seize the important dam in the New Kachovka city, that controls the water supply to the Crimea.

Kaukaz comes with new counters (of Russians and Ukrainians) and small board, covering the battle area. Some additional markers are included as well. Set of the rules of WW3 system is needed.

In Kaikoro you'll face five powerful Kaijus while defending the last city of the earth. Use the dice to attack them, get victory points and combine powerful combos to defeat them before the other players.

—description from the designer


THE KAIJUS HAVE AWAKENED, BE THE HERO YOU ARE DESTINED TO BE AND SAVE YOUR CITY ALONE OR WITH FRIENDS!

1. ATTACK THE KAIJUS! Roll all the power dice, the red one will dictate which Kaijus you can attack, and the green power dice the numbers you can use, BE THE BEST STRATEGIST!

2. EARN RESOURCES! During the battle, by effectively attacking the Kaijus, they will drop resources that you can use to improve your defenses, gain points or launch powerful extra attacks. USE YOUR RESOURCES WISELY!

3. BEWARE OF THE KAIYUS! After your attack, roll the red power die once again, the indicated Kaijus will advance towards your city, once there they will begin to destroy it! SAVE YOUR CITY!

A game with 50 round cards in a tin box. Each card has a letter and a category.

The players have to find a word which starts with the letter of the first card and belongs to the category of the second card. The player who finds a valid word first, collects the card, uncovers and reads the next pair of letter and category.

The player with the most gathered cards wins the game.

This is the children's version of the game Wort Blitz Kartenspiel.

In the heart of middle-class England in the 1920s, murderous passions are unleashed. The Yard sends you. Read the statements of the seven suspects and sort out the truth from the falsehood. Your goal: to identify the culprit.

Huis Clos: Season 1 - Winsbury Manor is a cooperative literary investigation game built like a detective series: 10 episodes, 23 characters, 10 victims. It's up to you to investigate!

Nearly twenty personalities will pass through the doors of the manor. The lure of money, the conquest of power and rivalries in love are all conducive to murderous passions.  The local police immediately called the Yard, which sent its best detectives to help. That's you!

Players are guided by the instructions given on the cards. There are 7 suspects per investigation. For each character, the players have an identity card and a statement to read aloud and try to be the first to deduce the murderer in each "episode".

The competitive shape-building game that tests your reflexes and mental agility with some fast-paced fun!

Each card shows a shape challenge, ranging from a four-block puzzle up to the trickier eight-block and mystery challenges. Players race to see who will be first to build the shape shown on the card using their wooden blocks.

The first player to win 10 challenges wins the game.

Open Cases is a fast and fun card game. Find the truth behind unsolved crimes!

Be the first investigator to find the culprit, the weapon used and the real motivation. Don't let other players get in the way of your investigation and prove that justice always prevails.
